TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MultiViewDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the Web server control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView> control is a container for a group of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> controls. An application renders a specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control to the client browser based on criteria that the application defines.
In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MultiViewDesigner> class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView> control in a visual designer.

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MultiViewDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overrides ReadOnly Property NoWrap As Boolean
protected: virtual property bool NoWrap { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates that the HTML attribute should not be used.
